title: How to Care for Flaming Katy

steps.headline: Position it in a light, sunny position.
steps.description: This is a plant that is happy to sit on the windowsill provided it doesn't get too hot. The preferred temperature is average warmth, although the cooler the room, the happier the plant will be.

steps.headline: Keep the soil semi moist between waterings and ensure that the soil is dry before watering again.
steps.description: It doesn't need a lot of watering. Too much watering can bring about root rot but too dry and the leaves will shrivel and turn yellow.

steps.headline: Feed it every two weeks when it's flowering.
steps.description: However, if you don't remember, it'll still thrive. A standard liquid fertiliser is appropriate.

steps.headline: If you want to cut the flowers off after flowering, then do so.
steps.description: Otherwise, don't worry about it. It's really only an aesthetics issue.

steps.headline: Take cuttings.
steps.description: Rather than trying to keep the plant flourishing after flowering, it's recommended that you take cuttings from it and grow new ones for the next year. And so on, for as long as you like. Cuttings should be placed in a soil-based compost.
